creator: julian@mehnle.net
text:
"IndexOptions VersionSort" apparently has problems with trailing filename parts, 
e.g. filename extensions such as ".tar.gz".  According to the documentation 
<http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_autoindex.html#indexoptions.
versionsort>, "foo-1.7" is supposed to sort before "foo-1.7.2", which works 
fine.  "foo-1.7.tar.gz" however, for example, does NOT sort before "foo-1.7.2.
tar.gz" (see <http://test.io.link-m.de/apache2/indexoptions-versionsort/>).

When comparing "\d+.bar" against "\d+.baz", couldn't mod_autoindex check whether 
"baz" == "\d+.bar" and then sort "\d+.bar" before "\d+.\d+.bar"?
